reviews.text: We wanted to visit the MB Aquarium on a budget and this place was ideal for our stay. The best part was purchasing two-day aquarium tickets at the front desk for the price of one; I think the deal is the inn is a Member and gets a discount. Free wireless internet was another pleasant surprise. It's sort of a motorlodge, small and quaint, in a quiet residential area among some other motels/inns and a golf course. The town was adorable with great places for breakfast (Red House Cafe and Lighthouse Cafe) and lovely Victorian homes to drool over. There's a lighthouse (Point Pinos) which was open 1-4Lots of antique shops, pet services and chiropractors. We walked to the Aquarium to avoid paying for parking and to see the cute streets all the better (@ 25 mins) There's a nature trail along the coast where we saw harbor seals and otters along with alot of bird life. We had dinners at Paradiso on Cannery Row and Hula's; both were nice.
reviews.title: Perfect for our visit to the Aquarium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a small refridgerator and coffee maker, apparently left over from the previous occupant's requests; it took a day to get the actual coffee, but it worked out. The closet was roomy. My friend didn't care for the firmness/condition of the mattress on her bed, but mine was okay. There's a fire pit where we toasted marshmallows and made smores, meeting some very interesting folks in residence. I'd stay here again, especially at the New Year's Special rate of $69.95/night.
reviews.title: All the staff was great!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for a very pleasant stay!!! We had a relaxing time so close to the water!! The staff was awesome and really took care of us!
reviews.title: Loved our stay we will be back!!

reviews.text: The staff was so helpful!!! We had an amazing stay. The rooms were so clean and updated we were pleasantly surprised. 2 blocks from the ocean how can you beat that. Very quiet and peaceful! Cannot wait to go back!
reviews.title: Nice property but thin walls

reviews.text: The Pacific Grove area has been a family favorite of mine for many years. We visit often and this is my third time at this motel. It is located in a quiet area and the property is typically peaceful and the grounds are clean and maintained. There is a gas firepit outside that added to the ambiance. Parking is just outside the room door which is convenient and the beach is walking distance away. I was traveling with extended family members and their rooms had been remodeled but mine was dated. My biggest complaint on this visit was the paper thin walls which wouldn't have been a big deal except we had loud neighbors for all of our three nights. Even when they quieted down at night, we could hear them talking quitely and coughing. There is also no A/C which wouldn't usually be a big deal given the cooler climate of Pacific Grove but we had neighbors smoking outside our window causing us to close it. Breakfast was Costco type muffins and juice which was actually pretty good. Ability to buy Aquarium tickets at the front desk was convenient. A decent property and I would still recommend it overall, but a little disapointed with the room noise and dated room.
reviews.title: Terrible
Neat and clean rooms
reviews.text: Stayed overnight on way to San Francisco. Nice, clean, comfortable rooms just out of Monterey in Pacific Grove (quieter part of town). Lovely continental breakfast in the morning, walk to the beach. Very reasonable rates.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Monterey for the weekend for our first wedding anniversary. The original hotel we booked our reservation did not have us on file as booking our reservation so we had to book these last minute.
reviews.title: No Thanks!!!
Buyer Beware
reviews.text: We arrived when it was dark and it appeared to be ok and cute on the outside. We checked in and we got our keys. We walked into our room and it seemed....ok. As I started to look around, there was no bathtub. There was only a shower stall. The shower had mold in the grout, not only on the walls but on the floor where you would have to step to take a shower. The towels were worn and the sheets had stains on them.

reviews.title: Bummer
reviews.text: The carpet was worn, dirty and disgusting. I couldn't even walk bare footed. There were obvious markings on the wall from prior customers. The room needed updated. Overall, it appeared the room was clean but only on the very surface.
The beds were broke down and not very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came across this place whilst looking through a local attractions brochure. It had a discount voucher, so we thought we'd check it out.
reviews.title: Excellent room, even better price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were police and courteous. Very helpful when asking for information on the local area and for directions etc.
reviews.title: There Are Better Choices For Your Dollar

reviews.text: The room was bright and spacious. Comfy bed, all the ammenities you would require. Overall a good nights stay!
reviews.title: Sea Breeze: Quiet, Clean, Friendly

reviews.text: Sea Breeze Inn & Cottages
reviews.title: I know the hotels use Pebble Beach to rip you off but this is ridiculous!

reviews.text: Gave this place a try from reading more positive reviews than negatives, staying 2 nights. On the positive side, the staff was friendly and attentive, the grounds were clean, lush and appealing, and the place is located near the beach. The room itself was okay and the king bed was comfortable. The “thin walls” issue pointed out by other reviewers wasn’t an issue for us, as we had an end unit.
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.text: The Sea Breeze Inn and Cottages is a find. Great looking rooms. Friendly Staff and above all fair rates. We'll be back.
reviews.title: A very nice room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay at the Sea Breeze Inn. I found a good rate online through booking.com. I called the hotel directly to try to book through them at the same rate, but they wouldn't do it - they wanted to charge $50-60 more per night.
reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but clean, quiet and friendly

reviews.text: We ended up with a cottage that had a queen bed, full bathroom, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hairdryer, and a rather small TV. The room was clean and pretty comfortable. The bed was ok - not too hard, but not very soft either. Would have been nice if the sheets and towels were of better quality.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a very quiet location - no problems with street noise or loud guests. FREE WIFI available throughout the property.
reviews.title: free gift with every room - FLEAS!!!

reviews.text: Although this is listed in TripAdvisor as a B&B, breakfast is barely passable. The breakfast consisted of a small table in the lobby that had some OJ, coffee and Costco-style muffins that were cut in half.
reviews.title: Pet rooms are filthy, staff uncooperative

reviews.text: Our room was very nice. We took our 18mo grandson & he was the test. He gets fussy at differant places we stay at. But this one he was right at home from the time we opened the door. My husband said this room was much nicer then most of the places we say at down in Anahiem & Norwalk Ca. And we go at least 4 times a yr. I have already recommended it to friends & family & we will be returning.Great location! We stayed 8/24-/26/09
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: In these difficult times we are all looking for extra value. The Sea Breeze Inn has it to spare. The rooms are well sized and well kept. The grounds are well landscaped and there is a pool and outdoor fire pit where my family spent a few hours chatting and taking in the beautiful night sky. The inn is close to the Monterey Bay Aquarium where we spent the better part of two days marveling at the great exhibitions. All in all a great vacation and a great value.
reviews.title: We Liked it a lot

reviews.text: Motel has been recently remodeled and done with taste. New linens, drapes, furniture. The grounds are nicely trimmed and manicured. My girls (ages 17 & 20) and I stayed at one of the Inns, which is better than the Lodge side. The staff is very congenial, the rooms are clean, and a bit more spacious than most. There was micro, fridge & coffee maker.
reviews.title: Devil is in the Details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location in Pacific Grove is good -- on Lighthouse Ave, which is the main street. A little too far to walk to downtown Pacific Grove, but less than 5 minute drive. It's very quiet, heard no neighbor noise, TV works fine.
reviews.title: Horrible Staff / Inaccurate Description / Over Priced
Loved the Sea Breeze Inn!
reviews.text: Okay, so now for the stupid details that were just so irritating:
